definition: to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload
great- (grandfather, grandchild etc)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
surname Zeng
to rub lightly/to move slowly/to dawdle/to dillydally/to pester/to nag
to dillydally/slow-going
to dillydally/slow-going
to scrape one's car against sth/to sideswipe
to freeload for food
to cadge a meal
to cadge a meal
(coll.) to use sb else's Internet connection (with or without permission)
(coll.) to sit in on a class
to have bad luck/dammit!
(coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)

sentences.english: Some preventive measures of skidding damage used on foreign aero-engines are listed.
sentences.chinese: 列舉了國外一些發動機中防止滑蹭損傷採用的措施。

sentences.english: Having rubbed his hands on the body, he began to stuff.
sentences.chinese: 在身上蹭了蹭手後，他便開始狼吞虎嚥地喫起來。

sentences.english: Having rubbed his hands on the body, he began to stuff.
sentences.chinese: 在身上蹭了蹭手後，他便開始狼吞虎嚥地喫起來。

sentences.english: The cat nuzzled up to my leg.
sentences.chinese: 貓咪在我的腿邊蹭來蹭去。

sentences.english: It goes far beyond the guy who always wants to mooch lunch off of me, too.
sentences.chinese: 這樣會使經常纏着我蹭飯喫的人產生非分之想。

sentences.english: Jack toed at a pebble on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 傑克不安的把腳趾在地上的鵝卵石上來回蹭着。

sentences.english: Kostya watched them drift from the door to the fountain.
sentences.chinese: 克斯特亞看着他們從門口蹭到噴泉那裏。

sentences.english: He head butted me in gratitude for not yelling at him.
sentences.chinese: 它用頭蹭着我對我沒有對它大吼表示感謝。

sentences.english: But trouble appears when your kneecap moves out of its track, or rubs up against its sides.
sentences.chinese: 如果你膝蓋移動出軌或蹭到了側面，那就會出問題。

sentences.english: The lion stood quite still, and rubbed his head against the man's shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 獅子很安靜地站在那兒，用頭蹭着安卓可利斯和肩膀。

sentences.english: Smelly wiped the clay off her trotters on the mat and came over.
sentences.chinese: 臭臭把蹄子上粘的泥土在墊子上蹭乾淨，然後走過來。

sentences.english: He had heard loungers about hotels called chair-warmers.
sentences.chinese: 他聽說過在旅館裏閒蕩的人被叫作蹭座者。

sentences.english: His new shoes raised blisters on his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他的新鞋把他的腳蹭起了泡。

sentences.english: Finally, you'll need a small rag or doormat to clean your shoes if you're bouldering outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 最後，如果你要在戶外抱石，你需要個蹭腳的墊子。

sentences.english: The animal snorted softly and bent its head to nuzzle her.
sentences.chinese: 那隻動物輕微哼着，低頭輕輕地蹭她。

definition: to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
variant of 扯[che3]/to pull/to tear
to freeload for food
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
to lick/to lap
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
buttocks/bottom/butt/back part
to touch/to meet with/to bump
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
(coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)
to weed/to grip or clutch
